III - ANALYSIS TABLE ABOUT THE STUDY
Researchers
University of Arizona, Dr. Erin Riordan
Published in
29 July 2020
General topic
Crop sustainability in arid environments (American desert)
Procedure / What was examined
Sustainability of different crops, conventional ones (like wheat, rice and soy) compared to indigenous ones (agaves, cacti, succulents and legumes) in an arid environment with a poor soil subjected to frequent droughts and floods, based on the requirements in terms of water, chemicals and energy.Benefits of the use of indigenous crops (ecosystems, health, working conditions).
Conclusion / discovery
Indigenous crops are the more thriving in arid climates.The researchers also give guidelines to plant the crops and implement them in the local economy
Remaining questions
The indigenous crops will have some difficulty challenging the industry preferences for more conventional crops. The research team believes their results could be applied to other similar regions.
